reasoning: 1. Circle of Competence: Frankly, streaming video feels more like Silicon Valley’s latest gadget than a moaty consumer staple. I’d rather stick to what I know – the likes of Coca-Cola or GEICO, not building ever-costly content libraries. 2. Competitive Moat: Netflix has scale and brand recognition, but its inconsistent ROE (just 1 of 10 periods above 15%) and limited pricing power put a question mark on any durable moat. 3. Management & Capital Allocation: Hastings & co. haven’t diluted shareholders heavily, and there are no dividends, but negative owner earnings (–0.74) suggest content spending is burning cash, not earning it. 4. Financial Health & Consistency: A weak ROE of 2.3%, spotty earnings patterns and a negative intrinsic value signal a business burning more capital than it generates. 5. Valuation vs. Intrinsic Value: A three-stage DCF spits out a negative intrinsic—–$11 per share—and a margin of safety well below zero. As I always say, ‘price is what you pay, value is what you get,’ and here you’re paying for rosy growth that hasn’t materialized. 6. Long-Term Prospects & Red Flags: Fierce competition from Disney+, Amazon and others means content costs will stay high and returns uncertain. 7. Relative to My Portfolio: I’d far prefer adding to Apple or Coca-Cola at a fair price than hoping Netflix turns burning cash into durable profits. In short, this one’s outside my circle, lacks a reliable moat, and trades well above any credible value—so my signal is a firm bearish.

fundamental_analysis.details: Weak ROE of 2.3%; Conservative debt levels; Strong operating margins; Current ratio data not available

consistency_analysis.details: Inconsistent earnings growth pattern; Total earnings growth of 75.5% over past 10 periods

moat_analysis.details: Inconsistent ROE: only 1/10 periods >15%; Decent operating margins (avg: 49.8%) suggest some competitive advantage

book_value_analysis.details: Consistent book value per share growth (Buffett's favorite metric)

management_analysis.details: No significant new stock issuance detected; No or minimal dividends paid

details: Using three-stage DCF: Stage 1 (8.0%, 5y), Stage 2 (4.0%, 5y), Terminal (2.5%)
